verdict: This comprehensive book covers several language arts topics in a kid-friendly way. Expect to help with some instructions, though.
pros: A 3-in-1 book that targets reading skills, vocabulary, and spelling exercises
Includes traditional fill-in-the-blank activities and fun challenges
Colorful, engaging, and easy to understand
cons: Some instructions are written in language too complex for young children
Would be easier to use if pages were perforated

all_review.title: Excellent
all_review.text: My 11-year-old grandson has high functioning autism. Where he struggles most is with reading. Up until now he’s been taking special education classes at the local public school, but with the virus, he will be homeschooled from now on. I wasn’t sure where to start and this book has been great. It’s helped a lot with his reading, helping him to understand and hear the sounds. I’m not sure he will ever read well, but these workbooks will be an asset in helping to read at least some. My goal is to get him reading at least on a second grade level. These books will aid greatly reaching that goal.

all_review.title: Great book. I got them all for end-of-year gifts ...
all_review.text: Great book. I got them all for end-of-year gifts to the kids I tutor in reading, best I've seen. In fact, had to send back a couple others and re-order these for everyone because they are so complete, so engaging and colorful. Lots of games to make it fun. The only thing I'm not sure about is that the directions for the exercises are really written in big words. If a kid can't figure out the exercise on their own, they need adult help to explain the point.

all_review.title: Using to avoid summer brain drain
all_review.text: I am utilizing this book as a summer brain drain avoidance method. My son needs to do a certain number of pages for iPad time. It is a great book that starts out with easier items and has slowly gotten to more complex items, which I think is preparing my son for 1st grade. I will definitely get the 2nd grade one next summer.
